instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP0V9_SSD: What is PP0V9_SSD? PP0V9_SSD is a power rail that powers the soldered on NAND memory for the SSD on Macbooks with soldered on storage and must be present for the SSD to show up. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead
threads.message:
please share power up sequence for this board 
(not in logiwiki)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead
threads.message:
Nor in other place.
Only 01055 and 01598 available, at the moment.

Power On Sequence for T2 boards is not so useful as for old models.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead
threads.message:
the problem with mlb <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> is dead
getting into dfu mode but can't revive/restore
checked -getting all awake /slp
but ssd voltages not getting
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_SSD</SIGNAL>= 0v and resistance to ground 29.5kohms(high)
<SIGNAL>PP0V9_SSD</SIGNAL> also 0v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead
threads.message: can you tell me the resistance to ground for  <SIGNAL>PP0V9_SSD</SIGNAL> please.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead
threads.message:
Try to search into the forum when you need something.
Is the fastest way to get it, not waiting for a reply.

[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1iYu7bOpqinZlWN18qHIKFDXvkSM2dk8O/view?usp=sharing[/URL]
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1oBr-qxYVfghYimgX6pwkNbwSjpQfYbKq/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

I don't have a note for such measurment on this board.
Flash <CHIP>U4770</CHIP> and try again DFU restore.
